result.execSummary:
The defendant George N Degroat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Employment to the best of defendant's ability so that Social Security is not affected.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim unless approved by victim's mother and Agent.  Contact is not to be violent if approved.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant George N Degroat in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant George N Degroat in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.
The Court has reviewed PSI as well as jail disciplinary report along with a letter from deft's wife. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI, reports and letter. No additions or corrections noted by parties.
The State recommends w/held sent - 2 yrs probation; approp and reasonable conditions including AODA assessment, no alc/cs-AODA and some jail time as well as cognitive intervention.

Defendant George N Degroat in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant George N Degroat in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Helmi Hamad
Preliminary hearing on February 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.

Defendant George N Degroat in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant George N Degroat in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
